questions.question: What is the defining characteristic of an XOR (Exclusive OR) logic gate's output when its two inputs are identical?
options: The output is always HIGH (logic 1).
The output is always LOW (logic 0).
The output is the inverse of the input.
The output depends on the previous state of the gate.
The output is indeterminate.

questions.question: In an out-of-order execution processor, what is the primary function of the Load/Store Queue (LSQ)?
options: To temporarily store decoded instructions awaiting execution.
To manage dependencies between arithmetic logic unit (ALU) operations.
To buffer and reorder memory access instructions (loads and stores) to maintain program order and detect memory dependencies.
To hold the results of speculative executions until they can be committed.
To resolve branch mispredictions by flushing incorrect instructions.

questions.question: In the physical verification and sign-off stages of advanced integrated circuit design, what is the primary purpose of Electromigration (EM) analysis?
options: To ensure all logical gates are properly connected according to the netlist.
To check for short circuits and open circuits in the metal layers.
To verify that power and ground networks can handle peak current demands without voltage droop.
To identify potential failures where metal atoms migrate due to electron flow, causing opens or shorts over the circuit's lifespan.
To optimize the placement of standard cells for minimum wire length.

questions.question: In a typical Field-Programmable Gate Array (FPGA) architecture, what is the main functional unit that combines Look-Up Tables (LUTs) with flip-flops to implement both combinational and sequential logic?
options: Input/Output Block (IOB)
Digital Signal Processing (DSP) Slice
Block RAM
Configurable Logic Block (CLB)
Phase-Locked Loop (PLL)

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the fundamental characteristic of non-volatile memory?
options: It can only be read from, not written to.
It requires a constant power supply to retain stored information.
It retains stored information even when power is removed.
It is significantly faster than volatile memory types.
It is typically used for CPU cache memory.
